Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the body is slightly convex with a large, applied handle, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and the handle is impressed with a stamp-mark identifying the supplier (?) as 'the house of Aten in Iunu (= Heliopolis)'.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393447) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393447)
Associated places: Named in inscription: House of the Aten at Iunu (historic)
